bib.title: A wordnet from the ground up
bib.author: Piasecki, Maciej and Broda, Bernd and Szpakowicz, Stanislaw
bib.abstract: A language without a wordnet is at a severe disadvantage. If this sounds outlandish to you, reconsider. Language technology is a signature area of computing on/for/around the Internet, a growing source of texts for all manner of automated processing, including increasingly clever search engines and more and more adequate machine translation. A wordnet–a rich repository of knowledge about words–is a key element of many a successful text processing or language processing application. The English WordNet, whose origins
